name: mkdir
longDescription: Create the DIRECTORY(ies), if they do not already exist.

options.name: p
options.description: Make any missing parent directories for each argument, setting their file permission bits to the umask modified by ‘u+wx’.  Ignore existing parent directories, and do not change their file permission bits.

options.name: m
options.description: Set the file permission bits of created directories to MODE, which uses the same syntax as in ‘chmod’ and uses ‘a=rwx’ (read, write and execute allowed for everyone) for the point of the departure.

options.name: v
options.description: Print a message for each created directory.  This is most useful with ‘--parents’.

options.name: Z
options.description: Without a specified CONTEXT, adjust the SELinux security context according to the system default type for destination files, similarly to the ‘restorecon’ command.  The long form of this option with a specific context specified, will set the context for newly created files only.  With a specified context, if both SELinux and SMACK are disabled, a warning is issued.

options.name: context
options.description: Without a specified CONTEXT, adjust the SELinux security context according to the system default type for destination files, similarly to the ‘restorecon’ command.  The long form of this option with a specific context specified, will set the context for newly created files only.  With a specified context, if both SELinux and SMACK are disabled, a warning is issued.

options.name: mode
options.description: Set the file permission bits of created directories to MODE, which uses the same syntax as in ‘chmod’ and uses ‘a=rwx’ (read, write and execute allowed for everyone) for the point of the departure.

options.name: parents
options.description: Make any missing parent directories for each argument, setting their file permission bits to the umask modified by ‘u+wx’.  Ignore existing parent directories, and do not change their file permission bits.

options.name: verbose
options.description: Print a message for each created directory.  This is most useful with ‘--parents’.
